Bengali: Bengali, an Indo-Aryan language, is the fourth-most spoken language in the world by number of native speakers. It is spoken in the Indian state of West Bengal and in the Indian states of Assam, Tripura and Odisha as well as in the northeastern parts of Bangladesh. It is also spoken by communities in some countries in Africa such as Mozambique, Rwanda and Tanzania.

Bengali is written using a modified version of the Devanagari script. Bengali is also known as Bangla, the native name of the language. It is the main language of literature and culture of Bangladesh and parts of West Bengal in India.

In addition to its literary usage, Bengali is used in radio and television broadcasting, newspapers and books. The dialects spoken in different regions vary significantly.

Bengali is a Sanskritized dialect of Magadhi Prakrit and is related to other Indo-Aryan languages such as Assamese, Bhojpuri, Odia, Dogri, Kashmiri, Punjabi, Rajasthani, Hindi and Marathi. In some regions it shares a common heritage with Nepali.

English: English is a West Germanic language that was first spoken in early medieval England and has since evolved into a global lingua franca and official language in many countries. It has developed over several centuries from several languages including Anglo-Frisian, Old English, Norman French and Latin. It was originally used for writing legal documents by Anglo-Saxon rulers and clerics during the early medieval period and was later adopted as a written standard for legal purposes by England's Norman rulers during the 12th century. The origins of English are uncertain but it has been suggested that it originated from Old English which was spoken by Anglo-Saxon settlers after the Anglo-Saxon conquest of England.

English has become an international lingua franca due to its widespread use in modern times as a medium for international communication and commerce. It is the de facto official language for many countries around the world including England, Ireland, Australia, Canada and many Commonwealth nations. It is also one of six official languages at the United Nations.

English is one of the most widely spoken languages in the world with over 400 million native speakers worldwide. It is estimated that around 1% of all books ever written are in English making it one of the most prolific languages for literature. Additionally, many technical terms have been adopted into other languages around the world due to their widespread use in English such as words like computer or internet which are now used internationally as lingua franca terms for these concepts.

English has also been heavily influenced by other languages due to its widespread use throughout history including French, Germanic languages like Dutch and Swedish as well as Romance languages like Italian and Spanish which were brought into contact with English during colonial expansion into Europe during the Middle Ages through trade relations with Italy especially via London's position on Europe's trade routes between London and Venice where many merchants from Italy settled down there during this time period leading to intercultural exchange between both nations which had a significant impact on each other's languages over time due to their close proximity to each other over centuries of contact through trade routes that spanned across multiple countries like Germany or Spain which were also connected through those same trade routes leading to more cultural exchange between those countries over time as well through cultural diffusion which led to changes being made to each others languages over time through constant contact between them

CRISPR-Cas9 is a genome editing tool that is a combination of CRISPR RNA-guided endonuclease Cas9 and trans-activating CRISPR RNA (tracrRNA). It is an advanced molecular biology technique that uses the CRISPR-Cas system to make targeted changes in the DNA of living organisms. The CRISPR-Cas system is found in some bacteria and archaea and is part of their immune systems. It consists of a CRISPR RNA sequence that is complementary to a specific piece of DNA that is targeted for editing. The Cas enzyme then cuts the targeted DNA at the precise location using its RNA guide. The use of Cas enzymes in this way allows for more precise editing than other methods such as restriction enzymes. This technology has many potential applications in medicine and agriculture, including gene therapy and crop modification.

"Tika" and "Samuday" are two components of the ancient Vedic fire sacrifice ritual of Agnihotra and Samudaya respectively. The word "Tika" means oblations to the fire and it is an integral part of the ritual of offering to the fire for purification and invoking the blessings of the deities. The word "Samudaya" refers to a particular type of fire sacrifice performed in Hinduism where the fire is used for purification and to appease the deities of water bodies such as lakes, rivers and seas. These two words are used interchangeably to refer to the act of offering something to the fire for purification and invoking the blessings of the deities. This practice is known as Tika in Bengal and Odisha while it is known as Samudaya in other parts of India. In both cases, these rituals are performed on religious festivals such as Chhath in Bengal and Odisha or Kojagiri Purnima in other parts of India as part of their religious observance and practice.

1. "Ph.D." stands for "Doctor of Philosophy". "Ph." is the abbreviation for the Latin word "philosophia", meaning love of wisdom. So, a Ph.D. candidate is someone who loves to learn and pursue wisdom in the field of study that they are interested in.
2. There are many different fields of study that you can get a Ph.D. in, such as science, engineering, humanities, social sciences, or business management. You need to choose a field that you are passionate about and have a genuine interest in learning more about it.

SDGs : Sustainable Development Goals, is a list of international goals adopted by the United Nations in 2015, to be achieved by 2030, with the aim of ending poverty, fighting inequality and injustice, and tackling climate change, among other things. The SDGs are a universal call to action to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure that all people enjoy peace and prosperity. These goals are an ambitious agenda to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all by 2030.

The SDGs provide a blueprint for governments, businesses and civil society organizations to work together to build a sustainable future for all. The goals cover a range of issues including economic growth, poverty reduction, climate change, health and education. Each goal has specific targets that aim to be achieved by 2030. The goals are designed to be universal in their application, applicable to all countries and people regardless of their stage of development or economic status. They also aim to create a world where no one is left behind.

The SDGs are a collective effort to address global challenges such as poverty, inequality, climate change and environmental degradation. They have been adopted by all United Nations Member States and are guided by the principle of leaving no one behind. The SDGs provide a framework for action that can help achieve sustainable development for all, leaving no one behind.
